intro: Chaetanthera flabellata, commonly known as the fan-flower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters, a feature typical of the carrot family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
